* Free admission: Preschoolers (ages 6 and younger), senior citizens (ages 65 and older) | |Restrooms:|Available| |Available Facilities:|Jukhyang Experience Village, Hanok Experience Site, Sibi Park, etc.| ## Detail Image ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/183587_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/183587_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/193168_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/193168_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/193180_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/193180_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/183586_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/183586_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2612513_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2612513_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2612516_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2612516_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2616764_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2616764_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2616766_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2616766_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2654489_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2654489_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2654490_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-25-1674617775383/2654490_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-61-380-2680](tel:+82613802680) - [üè†juknokwon.go.kr](http://juknokwon.go.kr) ```googleMap latitude: 35.3278000230 longitude: 126.9855748414 title: 119, Jungnogwon-ro, Damyang-gun, Jeollanam-do ``` ## Directions [Train + Bus]
From Yongsan Station, take a train to Gwangju Station.
From Gwangju Station Bus Stop, take Bus No. 311 and get off a Juknokwon Bus Stop.

data.title: Juknokwon (Bamboo Garden) (Ï£ΩÎÖπÏõê)
data.description: Juknokwon in Damyang is a bamboo forest cultivated by the town of Damyang. This bamboo forest, at approximately 160,000 „é° in size, was formed in May 2003. The rock steps and winds blown between the bamboo trees provide relief from daily stress. Try bamboo leaf tea for a perfect end to the visit.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Samhakdo Island (ÏÇºÌïôÎèÑ)
dataList.description: According to legend, Samhakdo Island and Yudalsan Mountain was the dream of Mokpo residents, before it became the land it is today. This island is filled with the loneliness of women waiting to see their husbands who voyaged out to sea, the hope of merchants waiting for their fishing boats, and the sorrow of people who have passed away. Samhakdo Island is a rich area where the people of Mokpo share their emotions.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Piagolgyegok Valley (ÌîºÏïÑÍ≥®Í≥ÑÍ≥°)
dataList.description:
Piagolgyegok Valley is located in Jirisan Mountain between Nogodan and Banyabong Peaks. The name of the valley comes from the crimson red maple leaves that fill the valley in fall. It is also one of the ten most beautiful highlights of Jirisan Mountain. The valley is famous for its fall colors, but it is also a beautiful place to visit all year around, from azaleas in spring to snow-covered rocks in winter.

Near the entrance to Piagolgyegok Valley is the largest temple in Jirisan Mountain, Yeongoksa Temple, and national treasures. The valley is not steep, providing an easy walk for all visitors. The trail stretches 6 kilometers from the ticket booth, and passes many beautiful places like Yeonjudam and Samhongso Pond. At the end of the valley, the trail continues another 2 kilometers up a steep hillside to reach Imgeollyeong Pass.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Nojeokbong Peak (ÎÖ∏Ï†ÅÎ¥â)
dataList.description: Nojeokbong Peak is marked by a large boulder on Yudalsan Mountain overlooking Mokpo. This peak was used during the Imjin War (1592-1598) by Admiral Yi Sun-sin to win a victory without fighting. Men made of straw were placed throughout the mountain to create the appearance of a larger force, causing the invading Japanese navy to flee.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Naro Wuju Beach (ÎÇòÎ°úÏö∞Ï£ºÌï¥ÏàòÏöïÏû•)
dataList.description: Naro Wuju Beach has gentle slopes and is shaded by 350-year-old pine trees. The scenery is beautiful due to the nearby evergreen forest designated as Natural Monument No. 362. The island is a treasured fishing location. Narodo Island is made up of Oe-narodo and Nae-narodo, located 36 kilometers southeast of Goheung-eup. In 1996, Yeollyukgyo Bridge and Yeondogyo Bridge were constructed, connecting the mainland and the islands allowing an easier way to visit without the necessity of a boat. Naro Wuju Beach is located on Oe-narodo Island and is a part of Dadohaehaesang National Park. It boasts beautiful scenery and the nearby Narodohang Port offers fresh seafood such as octopus, crab, live fish, and shellfish at low prices.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Nangman Pocha (ÎÇ≠ÎßåÌè¨Ï∞®)
dataList.description: Nangman Pocha (romance street stalls) offers 18 different resturants that provides various type of food while enjoying the beautiful nightscape of Yeosu and exciting performances.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Najuho Lake (ÎÇòÏ£ºÌò∏)
dataList.description: Najuho Lake is a man-made reservoir that holds about 91 million tons of water. Najuho Lake spans across Panchon-ri, Gungwon-ri and Bangsan-ri in Dado-myeon. The dam that created the lake was completed in 1976 and is about 496 meters in length. The lake is a favored vacation and fishing site, with beautiful scenery and abundance of freshwater fish. Nearby attractions include temples, forests and a golf course.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Naju Moksanaea (ÎÇòÏ£ºÎ™©ÏÇ¨ÎÇ¥ÏïÑ)
dataList.description: Naju Moksanaea was the private residence of Najus moksa, the title of highest official in the region. This traditional hanok house was built in 1825 and follows the traditional hanok design of a wealthy aristocrat. It is recognized as Jeollanam-do Cultural Hertiage Material.
dataList.author: korea-tour
